page.title: 08Land Usage at Budds Farm
page.content: {Budds Farm}grows no arable crops. There are varying types of trees on the farm, the most common being oak and silver birch. The farmer has deliberately kept all the old hedges, only two had been pulled out recently to make one large field out of two smaller ones. The farm house has a lovely cottage garden with a concrete path leading from the gate in the hedge along the road to the front door. The garden also has a vegetable patch, which is well kept and producing vegetables for the house. The vegetables seen growing included runner beans, potatoes, lettuce and cabbage. There was also Rhubarb aand a plum tree.
